name: Wall Balls
how_to_perform:
1. Start with the ball resting against a wall at shoulder height, with both hands gripping the ball equally.
2. Begin in a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine.
3. From the squat position, explosively jump up, using the force from the movement to propel you upwards.
4. At the top of the movement, catch the ball at chest height, with both hands in a controlled manner.
5. Quickly return to the squat position after catching the ball, then immediately repeat the explosive motion, jumping again and catching the ball at its peak position.
6. Continue this rapid up-and-down motion for the desired number of repetitions.
7. Make sure to maintain proper form throughout the exercise by keeping your back straight, engaging your core, and landing softly with each repetition.
short_summary: Wall Balls are a plyometric exercise that targets muscles in the glutes, legs, hips, and lower back through rapid movement.
